trans-unit.source: Learn how a user can interact with a background app through the Cortana voice and canvas during the execution of a voice command.
trans-unit.target: Learn how a user can interact with a background app through the Cortana voice and canvas during the execution of a voice command.

trans-unit.target: Interact with a background app

trans-unit.target: Interact with a background app in Cortana

trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands
trans-unit.target: Windows.ApplicationModel.VoiceCommands

trans-unit.source: Voice Command Definition (VCD) elements and attributes v1.2
trans-unit.target: Voice Command Definition (VCD) elements and attributes v1.2

trans-unit.source: Learn how a user can interact with a background app through the **Cortana** voice and canvas during the execution of a voice command.
trans-unit.target: Learn how a user can interact with a background app through the **Cortana** voice and canvas during the execution of a voice command.

trans-unit.source: Voice commands with **Cortana** can include a rich user experience and interaction flow within **Cortana** that is controlled by the background app.
trans-unit.target: Voice commands with **Cortana** can include a rich user experience and interaction flow within **Cortana** that is controlled by the background app.

trans-unit.source: The app can specify a number of different types of screens to support functionality that includes:
trans-unit.target: The app can specify a number of different types of screens to support functionality that includes:

trans-unit.source: Successful completion
trans-unit.target: Successful completion

trans-unit.source: Hand-off
trans-unit.target: Hand-off

trans-unit.source: Progress
trans-unit.target: Progress

trans-unit.source: Confirmation
trans-unit.target: Confirmation

trans-unit.source: Disambiguation
trans-unit.target: Disambiguation

trans-unit.source: Error
trans-unit.target: Error

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: This topic builds on [Launch a background app with voice commands in Cortana](launch-a-background-app-with-voice-commands-in-cortana.md).
trans-unit.target: This topic builds on [Launch a background app with voice commands in Cortana](launch-a-background-app-with-voice-commands-in-cortana.md).

trans-unit.source: We continue here to demonstrate features with a trip planning and management app named **Adventure Works**.
trans-unit.target: We continue here to demonstrate features with a trip planning and management app named **Adventure Works**.

trans-unit.source: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.
trans-unit.target: If you're new to developing Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, have a look through these topics to get familiar with the technologies discussed here.

trans-unit.source: Create your first app
trans-unit.target: Create your first app

trans-unit.source: Learn about events with [Events and routed events overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185584)
trans-unit.target: Learn about events with [Events and routed events overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt185584)

trans-unit.source: User experience guidelines:
trans-unit.target: User experience guidelines:

trans-unit.source: See [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for info about how to integrate your app with **Cortana** and [Speech design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn596121) for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.
trans-unit.target: See [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for info about how to integrate your app with **Cortana** and [Speech design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn596121) for helpful tips on designing a useful and engaging speech-enabled app.

trans-unit.source: Completion screen
trans-unit.target: Completion screen

trans-unit.source: A completion screen provides the user with information about the completed voice command task.
trans-unit.target: A completion screen provides the user with information about the completed voice command task.

trans-unit.source: Tasks that take less than 500 milliseconds for your app to respond, and require no additional information from the user, can be completed without further participation from **Cortana**, other than displaying the completion screen.
trans-unit.target: Tasks that take less than 500 milliseconds for your app to respond, and require no additional information from the user, can be completed without further participation from **Cortana**, other than displaying the completion screen.

trans-unit.source: Here, we show how **Cortana** can display a cancellation result from the **Adventure Works** app for an upcoming trip to Las Vegas.
trans-unit.target: Here, we show how **Cortana** can display a cancellation result from the **Adventure Works** app for an upcoming trip to Las Vegas.

trans-unit.source: cortana background app completion screen
trans-unit.target: cortana background app completion screen

trans-unit.source: Choose the feedback strings to be displayed and spoken by Cortana
trans-unit.target: Choose the feedback strings to be displayed and spoken by Cortana

trans-unit.source: Follow the [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for recommendations on composing strings that **Cortana** shows and speaks.
trans-unit.target: Follow the [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for recommendations on composing strings that **Cortana** shows and speaks.

trans-unit.source: Choose content tiles based on the action performed (optional)
trans-unit.target: Choose content tiles based on the action performed (optional)

trans-unit.source: Content tiles can provide additional context for the user and help keep the feedback strings concise.
trans-unit.target: Content tiles can provide additional context for the user and help keep the feedback strings concise.

trans-unit.source: **Cortana** supports the following content tile templates (only one template can be used on the completion screen):
trans-unit.target: **Cortana** supports the following content tile templates (only one template can be used on the completion screen):

trans-unit.source: Title only
trans-unit.target: Title only

trans-unit.source: Title with up to three lines of text
trans-unit.target: Title with up to three lines of text

trans-unit.source: Title with icon
trans-unit.target: Title with icon

trans-unit.source: Title with icon and up to three lines of text
trans-unit.target: Title with icon and up to three lines of text

trans-unit.source: The icon can be:
trans-unit.target: The icon can be:

trans-unit.source: 68w x 68h
trans-unit.target: 68w x 68h

trans-unit.source: 68w x 92h
trans-unit.target: 68w x 92h

trans-unit.source: You can also let users launch your app in the foreground by either tapping a tile or the text link to your app.
trans-unit.target: You can also let users launch your app in the foreground by either tapping a tile or the text link to your app.

trans-unit.source: Show the successful completion screen
trans-unit.target: Show the successful completion screen

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of a successful completion screen with multiple content tiles.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of a successful completion screen with multiple content tiles.

trans-unit.source: Hand-off screen
trans-unit.target: Hand-off screen

trans-unit.source: Once a voice command is recognized, **Cortana** must present feedback within approximately 500 milliseconds.
trans-unit.target: Once a voice command is recognized, **Cortana** must present feedback within approximately 500 milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: If the app service cannot complete the action specified by the voice command within 500ms, **Cortana** presents a hand-off screen that is shown for up to 5 seconds.
trans-unit.target: If the app service cannot complete the action specified by the voice command within 500ms, **Cortana** presents a hand-off screen that is shown for up to 5 seconds.

trans-unit.source: The app icon and name are displayed on the hand-off screen, and you must provide both GUI and text-to-speech (TTS) handoff strings to indicate that the voice command was correctly understood.
trans-unit.target: The app icon and name are displayed on the hand-off screen, and you must provide both GUI and text-to-speech (TTS) handoff strings to indicate that the voice command was correctly understood.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of a hand-off screen for the **Adventure Works** app.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of a hand-off screen for the **Adventure Works** app.

trans-unit.source: In this example, a user has queried **Cortana** for upcoming trips.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a user has queried **Cortana** for upcoming trips.

trans-unit.source: The hand-off screen includes a message customized with the app service name, an icon, and the **Feedback** string declared in the VCD file.
trans-unit.target: The hand-off screen includes a message customized with the app service name, an icon, and the **Feedback** string declared in the VCD file.

trans-unit.source: cortana background app hand-off screen
trans-unit.target: cortana background app hand-off screen

trans-unit.source: Progress screen
trans-unit.target: Progress screen

trans-unit.source: If the app service takes more than 500ms between steps, **Cortana** updates the user on what’s happening with a progress screen.
trans-unit.target: If the app service takes more than 500ms between steps, **Cortana** updates the user on what’s happening with a progress screen.

trans-unit.source: The app icon is displayed, and you must provide both GUI and TTS progress strings to indicate that the task is being actively handled.
trans-unit.target: The app icon is displayed, and you must provide both GUI and TTS progress strings to indicate that the task is being actively handled.

trans-unit.source: **Cortana** shows a progress screen for a maximum of 5 seconds.
trans-unit.target: **Cortana** shows a progress screen for a maximum of 5 seconds.

trans-unit.source: After 5 seconds, **Cortana** presents the user with an error message and the app service is closed.
trans-unit.target: After 5 seconds, **Cortana** presents the user with an error message and the app service is closed.

trans-unit.source: If the app service needs more than 5 seconds to complete the action, it can continue to update **Cortana** with progress screens.
trans-unit.target: If the app service needs more than 5 seconds to complete the action, it can continue to update **Cortana** with progress screens.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of a hand-off screen for the **Adventure Works** app.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of a hand-off screen for the **Adventure Works** app.

trans-unit.source: In this example, a user has canceled a trip to Las Vegas through **Cortana**.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a user has canceled a trip to Las Vegas through **Cortana**.

trans-unit.source: The progress screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.
trans-unit.target: The progress screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.

trans-unit.source: cortana background app progress screen
trans-unit.target: cortana background app progress screen

trans-unit.source: Choose the feedback strings to be displayed and spoken by Cortana
trans-unit.target: Choose the feedback strings to be displayed and spoken by Cortana

trans-unit.source: Follow the [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for recommendations on composing strings that **Cortana** shows and speaks.
trans-unit.target: Follow the [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for recommendations on composing strings that **Cortana** shows and speaks.

trans-unit.source: Choose content tiles based on the action performed (optional)
trans-unit.target: Choose content tiles based on the action performed (optional)

trans-unit.source: Content tiles can provide additional context for the user and help keep the feedback strings concise.
trans-unit.target: Content tiles can provide additional context for the user and help keep the feedback strings concise.

trans-unit.source: **Cortana** supports the following content tile templates (only one template can be used on the completion screen):
trans-unit.target: **Cortana** supports the following content tile templates (only one template can be used on the completion screen):

trans-unit.source: Title only
trans-unit.target: Title only

trans-unit.source: Title with up to three lines of text
trans-unit.target: Title with up to three lines of text

trans-unit.source: Title with icon
trans-unit.target: Title with icon

trans-unit.source: Title with icon and up to three lines of text
trans-unit.target: Title with icon and up to three lines of text

trans-unit.source: The icon can be:
trans-unit.target: The icon can be:

trans-unit.source: 68w x 68h
trans-unit.target: 68w x 68h

trans-unit.source: 68w x 92h
trans-unit.target: 68w x 92h

trans-unit.source: You can also let users launch your app in the foreground by either tapping a tile or the text link to your app.
trans-unit.target: You can also let users launch your app in the foreground by either tapping a tile or the text link to your app.

trans-unit.source: Build the response
trans-unit.target: Build the response

trans-unit.source: Call [**ReportProgressAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706579) to show the progress screen in **Cortana**.
trans-unit.target: Call [**ReportProgressAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706579) to show the progress screen in **Cortana**.

trans-unit.source: Show the progress screen
trans-unit.target: Show the progress screen

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of a progress screen with a content tile.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of a progress screen with a content tile.

trans-unit.source: Confirmation screen
trans-unit.target: Confirmation screen

trans-unit.source: When an action specified by a voice command is irreversible, has a significant impact, or the recognition confidence is not high, an app service can request confirmation.
trans-unit.target: When an action specified by a voice command is irreversible, has a significant impact, or the recognition confidence is not high, an app service can request confirmation.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of a confirmation screen for the **Adventure Works** app.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of a confirmation screen for the **Adventure Works** app.

trans-unit.source: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through **Cortana**.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through **Cortana**.

trans-unit.source: The app service has provided **Cortana** with a confirmation screen that prompts the user for a yes or no answer before canceling the trip.
trans-unit.target: The app service has provided **Cortana** with a confirmation screen that prompts the user for a yes or no answer before canceling the trip.

trans-unit.source: If the user says something other than "Yes" or "No", **Cortana** cannot determine the answer to the question.
trans-unit.target: If the user says something other than "Yes" or "No", **Cortana** cannot determine the answer to the question.

trans-unit.source: In this case, **Cortana** prompts the user with a similar question provided by the app service.
trans-unit.target: In this case, **Cortana** prompts the user with a similar question provided by the app service.

trans-unit.source: On the second prompt, if the user still doesn’t say "Yes" or "No", **Cortana** prompts the user a third time with the same question prefixed with an apology.
trans-unit.target: On the second prompt, if the user still doesn’t say "Yes" or "No", **Cortana** prompts the user a third time with the same question prefixed with an apology.

trans-unit.source: If the user still doesn’t say "Yes" or "No", **Cortana** stops listening for voice input and asks the user to tap one of the buttons instead.
trans-unit.target: If the user still doesn’t say "Yes" or "No", **Cortana** stops listening for voice input and asks the user to tap one of the buttons instead.

trans-unit.source: The confirmation screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.
trans-unit.target: The confirmation screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.

trans-unit.source: cortana background app confirmation screen
trans-unit.target: cortana background app confirmation screen

trans-unit.source: Choose the feedback strings to be displayed and spoken by Cortana
trans-unit.target: Choose the feedback strings to be displayed and spoken by Cortana

trans-unit.source: Follow the [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for recommendations on composing strings that **Cortana** shows and speaks.
trans-unit.target: Follow the [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for recommendations on composing strings that **Cortana** shows and speaks.

trans-unit.source: Choose content tiles based on the action performed (optional)
trans-unit.target: Choose content tiles based on the action performed (optional)

trans-unit.target: Content tiles can provide additional context for the user and help keep the feedback strings concise.

trans-unit.target: **Cortana** supports the following content tile templates (only one template can be used on the completion screen):

trans-unit.target: Title only

trans-unit.target: Title with up to three lines of text

trans-unit.target: Title with icon

trans-unit.source: Title with icon and up to three lines of text
trans-unit.target: Title with icon and up to three lines of text

trans-unit.target: The icon can be:

trans-unit.target: 68w x 68h

trans-unit.target: 68w x 92h

trans-unit.source: You can also let users launch your app in the foreground by either tapping a tile or the text link to your app.
trans-unit.target: You can also let users launch your app in the foreground by either tapping a tile or the text link to your app.

trans-unit.source: Build the response
trans-unit.target: Build the response

trans-unit.source: Call [**RequestConfirmationAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706582) to show the confirmation screen in **Cortana**.
trans-unit.target: Call [**RequestConfirmationAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706582) to show the confirmation screen in **Cortana**.

trans-unit.source: Show the confirmation screen
trans-unit.target: Show the confirmation screen

trans-unit.target: Here's an example of a confirmation screen with a content tile.

trans-unit.source: Disambiguation screen
trans-unit.target: Disambiguation screen

trans-unit.source: When an action specified by a voice command has more than one possible outcome, an app service can request more info from the user.
trans-unit.target: When an action specified by a voice command has more than one possible outcome, an app service can request more info from the user.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of a disambiguation screen for the **Adventure Works** app.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of a disambiguation screen for the **Adventure Works** app.

trans-unit.source: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through **Cortana**.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through **Cortana**.

trans-unit.source: However, the user has two trips to Las Vegas on different dates and the app service cannot complete the action without the user selecting the intended trip.
trans-unit.target: However, the user has two trips to Las Vegas on different dates and the app service cannot complete the action without the user selecting the intended trip.

trans-unit.source: The app service provides **Cortana** with a disambiguation screen that prompts the user to make a selection from a list of matching trips, before it cancels any.
trans-unit.target: The app service provides **Cortana** with a disambiguation screen that prompts the user to make a selection from a list of matching trips, before it cancels any.

trans-unit.source: In this case, **Cortana** prompts the user with a similar question provided by the app service.
trans-unit.target: In this case, **Cortana** prompts the user with a similar question provided by the app service.

trans-unit.source: On the second prompt, if the user still doesn’t say something that can be used to identify the selection, **Cortana** prompts the user a third time with the same question prefixed with an apology.
trans-unit.target: On the second prompt, if the user still doesn’t say something that can be used to identify the selection, **Cortana** prompts the user a third time with the same question prefixed with an apology.

trans-unit.source: If the user still doesn’t say something that can be used to identify the selection, **Cortana** stops listening for voice input and asks the user to tap one of the buttons instead.
trans-unit.target: If the user still doesn’t say something that can be used to identify the selection, **Cortana** stops listening for voice input and asks the user to tap one of the buttons instead.

trans-unit.source: The disambiguation screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.
trans-unit.target: The disambiguation screen includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and a content tile with information about the trip being canceled.

trans-unit.source: cortana background app disambiguation screen
trans-unit.target: cortana background app disambiguation screen

trans-unit.target: Choose the feedback strings to be displayed and spoken by Cortana

trans-unit.target: You can also let users launch your app in the foreground by either tapping a tile or the text link to your app.

trans-unit.target: Call [**RequestDisambiguationAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn706583) to show the disambiguation screen in **Cortana**.

trans-unit.source: Error screen
trans-unit.target: Error screen

trans-unit.source: When an action specified by a voice command cannot be completed, an app service can provide an error screen.
trans-unit.target: When an action specified by a voice command cannot be completed, an app service can provide an error screen.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example of an error screen for the **Adventure Works** app.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example of an error screen for the **Adventure Works** app.

trans-unit.source: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through **Cortana**.
trans-unit.target: In this example, a user has instructed the app service to cancel a trip to Las Vegas through **Cortana**.

trans-unit.source: However, the user does not have any trips scheduled to Las Vegas.
trans-unit.target: However, the user does not have any trips scheduled to Las Vegas.

trans-unit.source: The app service provides **Cortana** with an error screen that includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and the specific error message.
trans-unit.target: The app service provides **Cortana** with an error screen that includes a message customized for the action, an icon, and the specific error message.

trans-unit.source: Choose the feedback strings to be displayed and spoken by Cortana
trans-unit.target: Choose the feedback strings to be displayed and spoken by Cortana

trans-unit.source: Follow the [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for recommendations on composing strings that **Cortana** shows and speaks.
trans-unit.target: Follow the [Cortana design guidelines](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn974233) for recommendations on composing strings that **Cortana** shows and speaks.
